value: A lodge at Dinner Plain near the Cobungra Platter in falling snow

Dinner Plain, which is located above the snowline in winter, is one of the few alpine areas in Australia with freehold land. Very strict planning controls ensure a certain uniformity of look: the buildings are all wooden veneers with a green-grey paint job to match the surrounding snow gums. In winter, Dinner Plain is a dormitory village for the
ski resort. In summer it's a good base for walking, hiking and cycling in the alpine area.
Dinner Plain is accessible by on the Great Alpine Road from
(45 kilometers) via Mount Hotham (20 kilometers) or from
(60 kilometers). If travelling through Mount Hotham, just tell the gate staff that you are driving right through to Dinner Plain and they will not charge you the entry fee. Fitting

must be carried after Harrietville or Omeo between June 1 and October 10 each year and you can be required to fit them at various points on the highway.

There is a bus service from Mount Hotham in winter, leaving from the Transit Center and opposite the Big D ski lift. Bus travellers would catch the Melbourne-Bright-Harrietville service to Mount Hotham and change at the transit center, but the bus is usually used by people skiing at Hotham and staying at Dinner Plain.

value: content=The Cobungra Platter ski slope is a short beginners' run, a good place for introductory lessons or a warm-up. A J-bar lift is provided, tickets for the lift and for lessons are available through many local shops.
content=Onsen has a Japanese inspired spa, day treatments including massage and hot stone therapy, a 15 metre lap pool and a gym.
Mountains as seen from the Room With a View walk

When there's not snow, the area has the following walks:

value: content=The Room With a View walk starts across the highway from the tennis courts, about 200 metres towards the Alpine School. After about 500 metres, it descends fairly gently down into the valley, ending in a clear area with a view of Mount Hotham and surrounding peaks. It is 4 kilometres return.

While Dinner Plain is far below the altitude at which
is usually a problem, if you've come up from sea level allow for these walks to be a little more difficult than you'd expect.

banking or automatic teller machine (ATM) facilities in Dinner Plain. The closest ATM is in Mount Hotham village. The supermarket and most cafes and restaurants accept EFTPOS (Australian debit cards) or credit cards. The Brandy Creek supermarket allows EFTPOS withdrawals ("cash out") for Australian debit cards, although you will need to make about $20 worth of purchases and pay $1 per $50 withdrawn.

There is no
(gas), or other fuel, for vehicles available in Dinner Plain or at Mount Hotham. The closest fuel is available in
, both of which require descending from the alpine area.

value: name=Brandy Creek Cafe and Licenced Supermarket
content=Brandy Creek is a small supermarket stocking most essentials such as milk, other drinks, and simple cooking ingredients.
name=Brandy Creek Cafe and Licenced Supermarket
content=Brandy Creek is one of the cheaper places to eat in Dinner Plain. It serves simple pies and toasted focaccias.

content=Crystal Creek Resort has a beautiful restaurant serving some of the loveliest food available in Dinner Plain. Don't let your whole table order the prawns, they tend to run out. Vegetarians are not especially well provided for, although there may be one vegetarian dish. Phone bookings are essential.
content=Relaxed pub with decent food, although it takes a while to arrive.

Most accommodation in Dinner Plain consists of private individuals' holiday houses, which they lease to travellers on a short-term basis when they aren't using them themselves. These are managed through central booking agencies:

value:
address=High Plains Lodge,
Big Muster Drive

In addition, there are many dedicated resorts that accommodate travellers year-round:

value: price=Double rooms from $170 per night in summer and the low winter season and $205 per night in the winter high season
price=Double rooms from $160 per night in summer and the low winter season and $205 per night in the winter high season
price=Entire lodge from $560 per night in the low season to $3475 per week in the high season (short stays may not be possible)

content=Kimberley Two is a three-storey lodge that accommodates 10 people. It can also be shared among 6 people at a lower rate with the top floor locked off, but this must be booked at least 30 days in advance.

mobile network does not have coverage in Dinner Plain — if you want to receive or make calls from your Vodafone mobile you will need to go to Mount Hotham.

both have coverage. In addition, many lodges have landline phones, which you could redirect your mobile number to.

Internet access is available at:

value: name=Brandy Creek Cafe and Licenced Supermarket

Postal facilities, including stamps and parcels, are also available at Brandy Creek. A red post box is located outside. The area is not on the Express Post loop, so sending Australian post using regular postage is just as fast.
